What are the genetic changes related to thiamine-responsive megaloblastic anemia syndrome ?,"Mutations in the SLC19A2 gene cause thiamine-responsive megaloblastic anemia syndrome. This gene provides instructions for making a protein called thiamine transporter 1, which transports thiamine into cells. Thiamine is found in many differ
